title: "Super-Bug" tabs and setting
content: I have several hundred tabs, tick them all and want to bookmark them, but that never works. Never! I uninstalled Firefox, reinstalled it. It still does not work. I've turned off all add-ons, it's still not working. The error has been present for 2 or 3 years! I also used a whole lot of tabs managers but not even one solved the problem, managers don't even see these tabs! In my case, Firefox is stable, pages open, so what makes it impossible to add or save tabs? I don't want to lose my open tabs. I searched all the help pages, tricks and it still doesn't work, nothing, nothing at all, not even reinstating a computer or anything else won't fix the problem. I will also add that the "Settings" menu does not open! This is unique (super-bug)!

title: Email From Mozilla
content:
Good morning. I unsubscribed from all communication from Mozilla Firefox. I clicked the unsubscribe link at the bottom of every email I received and yet, since this past Saturday, I am STILL getting email from Mozilla. I even changed my email address and unsubscribed again but since Saturday there are 3 more emails from Mozilla in my mailbox. I want it to stop but there appears nothing else I can do, I already unsubscribed from everything I could find. Not really a fan of unsolicited email and I don't give my email address out because of it. I don't expect it from Mozilla which is supposed to be all about security and privacy. I am not subscribed to firefox account tips. I posted a few images to show what I am talking about.

Thanks

William Doyle
creator: irish011071

title: Trackers
content: Maybe someone from Firefox tech help can explain to me , i have enhanced privacy on', delete all after i shut down firefox, no third party cookies accepted etc....... after i shut down the browser from say watching 2 movies i have ccleaner and other various moniters saying its finding 2-4000 trackers they have to delete. also am being redirected to other websites and im sure the site im on isnt hacked'. google which i stopped using had about 400 trackers after the same. also have adblocker plus running all the time with strict settings. call me crazy but spying on me is not acceptable under any conditions! so if firefox is blocking them why are other programs finding trackers with a long long list to delete? Im sure this post will be deleted as i may be letting the cat out of the bag to unsuspecting other users of firefox. have a nice day.

creator: kyramas

title: Disable Popup Auto-Hide not working on Firefox 90.0 64 bit under Ubuntu 20.04
content:
I am unable to find the menu option under "Web Developer Tools" -> "..." drop down menu as described at the below page.

https://extensionworkshop.com/documentation/develop/debugging/#debugging-popups

Also manually changing the "about:config" properties related to "devtools.popup.disable_autohide" and "ui.popup.disable_autohide" appear to have no effect at stopping html popups from being hidden when selecting the web developer tools window.

Is anyone else able to make this work?

I found the following curious commit which makes it sound like it may have been disabled on purpose, but I'm uncertain.

https://git.progress-linux.org/packages/engywuck/firefox-esr/commit/browser/app?h=debian&id=a7c8db0d7d4a7493e340a0cd3a41da435ef45823

"author Daniel Baumann <daniel.baumann@progress-linux.org> 2021-03-11 04:07:20 +0000 committer Daniel Baumann <daniel.baumann@progress-linux.org> 2021-03-11 04:07:20 +0000 commit a7c8db0d7d4a7493e340a0cd3a41da435ef45823 (patch) tree c3d79096d0a92925e4d9a7878128ad775c4086b5 /browser/app"

+// Disable autohide for DevTools popups and tooltips. +// This is currently not exposed by any UI to avoid making +// about:devtools-toolbox tabs unusable by mistake. +pref("devtools.popup.disable_autohide", false);
creator: 2snh2jhmcbg8v4b

title: Cannot enable add-ons
content:
Some of my add-ons have disabled themselves and there is no option to enable. I found a potential solution at this thread https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1276602 but wanted to clarify what to delete in the Profile Folder. I can't continue that thread because it is too old apparently.

The help says to: Delete all extensions* fileS and compatibility.ini in the Firefox profile folder to reset the extensions registry. There is only ONE FILE starting with extensionS. That would be extensions.json

content:

title: can't seem to change audio input
content: Hi all, I'm having an annoying problem. A couple weeks ago, I was having major computer problems that required me to completely delete and recreate my user profile. I apparently hadn't logged into Google Voice since then, but decided to try and call a friend from that number today. When I tried to call her though, she couldn't hear me. Subsequent testing revealed that the problem is that Firefox isn't using my computer's microphone as the input, but rather it's taking the input from Stereo Mix, despite the default input device on my computer being the microphone. How do I change this within Firefox? I also have a wireless headset that I use sometimes, but when I plug that in, none of the audio switches to it. If desired, is there a way to get Firefox to use this device for audio output?
creator: cavbob1993

title: firefox browser
content:
Problems with glitzy new browser: 1. Home page replaced by a mystery page. That page appears even without an Internet connection. 2. Address bar does not allow a keyed or pasted URL. 3. Colors at top of screen blot out the min, max, and close buttons and make the open page buttons unreadable.except for active page button. 4. Moving to a new, or even a follow-up, page is slower.

I have been with Mozilla ever since the early days with the Netscape browser, and have always been happy with the many updates, that is, until this one. Get rid of the colors, and make the address bar functional again. I found the solution to the "mystery page" in Tools/Settings and reclaimed my home page, "homepage." I hope it holds.
